description: Students translate selections from one or more genres of ancient Latin literature while exploring a
specific topic or theme chosen by the instructor.  Close study of the text is combined with
discussion of broader literary, historical, and cultural questions.  Sample topics: "Ovid," "Ancient
Biographies of the Roman Emperors," "Latin Epistolography," "Augustan Elegy."  Prerequisite:
Latin 231 or equivalent.  Offered every third year.
